newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Unbundled Malbak sees yr earnings growth.
newsitem.headline: Unbundled Malbak sees yr earnings growth.

text.p: Malbak Ltd, the South African conglomerate which recently unbundled, said on Thursday it expected a satisfactory improvement in earnings for the year to end-August.

"...(Given) the forecast improvement in earnings expected from Kohler and MY Holdings for the balance of the financial yar, a satisfactory result (for the Malbak group) is expected," directors said in a statement.
Following Malbak's unbundling, the group's primary assets are a 68 percent stake in Kohler Ltd and a 64 percent interest in U.K-listed MY Holdings Plc -- constituting it as a packaging group.

Malbak earlier released its last results as a conglomerate company but said the figures were not comparable to 1996's interim numbers following the shedding of most of its units during the period as the unbundling gathered pace.
It said the "new" Malbak would, in the six month period, have shown proforma attributable earnings at 71 million rand -- a 25 percent improvement on 57 million rand a year ago.
Pro-forma earnings per share would have amounted to 21 cents as against the previous year's 16.9 cents, Malbak said.
Turnover would have risen 10 percent to 1.56 billion rand on which operating income of 151 million rand, 15 percent ahead of the previous year, would have been earned.
